project.teaser: SmartLivingEPC project aims to deliver a certificate which will be issued with the use of digitized tools and retrieve the necessary assessment information for the building shell and building systems from BIM literacy, including enriched energy and sustainability related...
project.objective: SmartLivingEPC project aims to deliver a certificate which will be issued with the use of digitized tools and retrieve the necessary assessment information for the building shell and building systems from BIM literacy, including enriched energy and sustainability related information for the as designed and the actual performance of the building. SmartLivingEPC will provide information in relation to the operational behaviour of the building, by introducing a new rating scale, based on a weighted approach of life cycle performance aspects, building smartness assessment and information on the actual performance of the technical systems of buildings provided by technical audits. The new methodologies to be developed, will be based on existing European standards, whereas at the same time, they will trigger the development of new technical standards for smart energy performance certificates. The new certification scheme will also expand its scope, covering aspects related to water consumption, as well as noise pollution and acoustics. SmartLivingEPC certificate will be fully compatible with digital logbooks, as well as with building renovation passports in order to allow the integration of the building energy performance information in digital databases. A special aspect of SmartLivingEPC will be its application in building complexes, with the aim of energy certification at the neighbourhood scale. SmartLivingEPC aspires to develop two parallel schemes, one at the building level (Building EPC) and one at the level of building complex level (Complex EPC), with the ultimate goal in the near future of certification of building complexes, based on the certification of individual units, as well as on additional aspects following an integrated participatory and neighborhood based approach. 16 partners from 12 European countries will collaborate and provide their expertise and resources within the 36 months of SmartLivingEPC lifetime.
project.title: Advanced Energy Performance Assessment towards Smart Living in Building and District Level
project.keywords: operational rating, Smart Readiness Indicator, LCA and LCC analysis, IEQ, BIM, digital twin, smart monitoring systems, Technical audits, Building complex assessment, Digital Logbooks, AI services

article.title: Optimising energy performance assessment and certification schemes

result.title: SmartLivingEPC pilot analysis, Use case scenarios and Framework Architecture v1
result.description: First version outlining the existing conditions of the pilots, use case scenarios and the high level architecture and system requirements. This deliverable will include the results from T1.3 &T1.4

result.title: EPCs calculation and APIs v1
result.description: Public version of the EPCs calculation module and the respective APIs for 3rd party applications, providing 1st level of information and framework design (linked with T4.5)

result.title: Asset methodology assessment in building level v1
result.description: This deliverable includes the results from T2.1-T2.4 elaborating on the various aspects of the asset methodology at building level, including aspects such as SRI, energy and non-energy resources, LCA and technical audits.

result.title: Project Website, Social Media & Visual Identity Package
result.description: Report on the project's dissemination and communication material, website and social media

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - SmartLivingEPC (Advanced Energy Performance Assessment towards Smart Living in Building and District Level)
result.teaser: The challenges and opportunities in advancing energy efficiency in buildings involve addressing technological innovations and sustainable living demands. This requires a shift in current energy performance certificates (EPCs) to consider not only energy efficiency but also...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.description: This deliverable includes the results from T3.1-T3.3 on the analysis of the different aspects of the SmartLivingEPC operational methodology at building level.

result.description: This report establishes a guideline about strategies and work-flows for the dissemination, exploitation and communication activities of the project. It is linked with T7.1 & T7.5

result.description: Public version for the Common Information Exchange Model and Building Dynamic Monitoring System including high-level design & implementation details. This deliverable will include the results from T4.1 & T4.2

result.title: Project events & Liaising with other projects & initiatives v1

result.title: Operational assessment methodology in building complex level v1
result.description: This deliverable includes the results from T3.4 elaborating on the operational methodology at complex level

result.title: Asset rating calculation methodology of SmartLivingEPC v1
result.description: First version outlining the SmartLivingEPC asset rating calculation methodology (linked with T2.6)

result.title: Data Management Plan v1
result.description: Detailed data management plan as well as ethics management in the project lifetime. This is linked with T8.4 and it will encapsulate open access to research data

result.description: First version outlining the SmartLivingEPC operational rating calculation methodology (linked with T3.5)

category.title: pollution
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/earth and related environmental sciences/environmental sciences/pollution

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
